numbered_ace_sentences: 1. It was interesting to see the effect of a student's legacy on the student's acceptance rate.
2. This effect is especially large for students who have parents with higher incomes.
3. For students who have parents with a mid income or a high income, legacy gives a significant boost to the acceptance rate.
4. I wonder why legacy is important to these colleges.
5. A parent and a child can differ significantly in character traits.
6. A parent and a child can differ significantly in personality.
7. Therefore, legacy is a questionable criterion for admitting students.
8. These colleges may have a goal.
9. This goal may be to attract the most intelligent students.
10. This goal may be to attract the most talented students.
11. This goal may be to attract the most skilled students.
12. I wonder why these colleges place an emphasis on legacy.
13. It seems irresponsible that these colleges accept students based on legacy.
14. It seems unfair to many highly talented students.
15. Some highly talented students are rejected because these students lack legacy.
